title: Help needed on how to use intel-mpi in intel-parallel-studio installed within Spack
body:
Hello, 

I followed the instruction "[Installing Intel tools within Spack](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/build_systems/intelpackage.html?highlight=intel#installing-intel-tools-within-spack)" installed `intel-parallel-studio/cluster.2018.3` successfully. But I wasn't able to make Spack select intel-mpi package in the studio. Here are what I tried: 


---

### Without configuring packages.yaml:

```console
$ spack spec fftw %intel ^intel-mpi
Input spec
--------------------------------
fftw%intel
    ^intel-mpi

Concretized
--------------------------------
fftw@3.3.8%intel@18.0.3+double+float~fma+long_double+mpi~openmp~pfft_patches~quad simd=avx,avx2,sse2 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
    ^intel-mpi@2019.0.117%intel@18.0.3 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
```

### With configuring packages.yaml

- `packages.yaml` as suggested in the [doc](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/build_systems/intelpackage.html?highlight=intel#selecting-libraries-to-satisfy-virtual-packages):

```console
packages:
    all:
        compiler: [intel, gcc]
        providers:
            mpi: [intel-parallel-studio+mpi, openmpi, mpich]
            blas: [intel-parallel-studio+mkl, openblas]
            lapack: [intel-parallel-studio+mkl, openblas]
            scalapack: [intel-parallel-studio+mkl, openblas]
```

It reports the error when concretized:
 
```console
$ spack spec fftw
Input spec
--------------------------------
fftw

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: Conflicts in concretized spec "fftw@3.3.8%intel@18.0.3+double+float~fma+long_double+mpi~openmp~pfft_patches~quad simd=avx,avx2,sse2 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64 /2h5m425"

List of matching conflicts for spec:

    intel-parallel-studio@professional.2018.3%intel@18.0.3~advisor~clck+daal~gdb~ilp64~inspector+ipp~itac+mkl+mpi~newdtags+rpath+shared+tbb threads=none ~vtune arch=linux-centos6-x86_64

1. "+mpi" conflicts with "intel-parallel-studio@professional.0:professional.9999"

``` 

I tried with adding the section of intel-parallel-studio section in `packages.yaml` as suggested in the [#11950](https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/11950) like below: 

```console
    intel-parallel-studio:
        paths:
            intel-parallel-studio@cluster.2018.3.222 +mkl+mpi+ipp+tbb+daal: /path/to/intel
        buildable: False
```
It reports the same error.

---

Any hints? Thanks.
